alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Frederick; Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:04PM EDT until September 07 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CARROLL COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND...NORTHWESTERN HOWARD...NORTHERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MARYLAND AND CENTRAL FREDERICK COUNTIES IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... At 304 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Walkersville, or near Frederick, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Frederick, Westminster, Thurmont, Eldersburg, Ballenger Creek, Mount Airy, Walkersville, Braddock Heights, New Market, Clover Hill, Discovery-Spring Garden, Linganore-Bartonsville, New Windsor, Woodsboro, Union Bridge, Libertytown, Monrovia, Carrollton, Winfield, and New Midway. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
